intro: Alseodaphnopsis, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a member of the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and prefers a warm, humid climate. Alseodaphnopsis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate various environmental conditions.
